claim: Mike Pence turned into a rightist spokesperson on talk radio.
LM: After losing two bids for a U.S. congressional seat in 1988 and 1990 , he became a conservative radio and television talk show host from 1994 to 1999 .

claim: Morena Baccarin is known for portraying Adria in Stargate SG-1.
LM: She is known for portraying Inara Serra in the series Firefly and the follow-up film Serenity , Adria in the series Stargate SG-1 and the follow-up film Stargate : The Ark of Truth , Anna in the 2009 version of the series V , Vanessa in the superhero comedy film Deadpool , and Jessica Brody in the Showtime series Homeland ( for which she received an Emmy nomination for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series in 2013 ) .

claim: Paris Hilton sings "Stars Are Blind."
LM: Hilton 's debut single " Stars Are Blind " was released worldwide in June 2006 and quickly became an instant hit around the world including number one in Scotland .

claim: Deadpool is part of a franchise.
LM: It is the eighth installment and a spin-off in the X-Men film series , and stars Ryan Reynolds as the titular character , as well as Morena Baccarin , Ed Skrein , T. J. Miller , Gina Carano , Leslie Uggams , Brianna Hildebrand , and Stefan Kapičić .

claim: Livestock form part of the basis of Somalia's economy.
LM: Somalia has maintained an informal economy , mainly based on livestock , remittances from Somalis working abroad , and telecommunications .

claim: The New Adventures of Old Christine stars Julia Louis-Dreyfus.
LM: The New Adventures of Old Christine ( often shortened to simply Old Christine ) is an American television sitcom starring Julia Louis-Dreyfus as Christine Campbell , a middle-aged divorced mother who struggles to keep pace with those around her .

claim: Love Aaj Kal is directed by Imtiaz Ali and produced by Saif Ali Khan.
LM: The film is directed by Imtiaz Ali and produced by Saif Ali Khan and Dinesh Vijan .

claim: Honey to the B was released in 1998.
LM: Honey to the B is the first album by the pop singer Billie Piper , released in 1998 ( see 1998 in music ) .

claim: Tina Turner worked on a musical based on her story.
LM: Turner announced in December 2016 that she has been working on " Tina " , a new musical based on her story , in collaboration with Phyllida Lloyd and Stage Entertainment .

claim: MTV renewed Snooki & Jwoww.
LM: On April 25 , 2013 , MTV renewed the series for a third season , which premiered on October 22 , 2013 .

claim: Yamaha Corporation exclusively produces fur coats.
LM: (  or   ) is a Japanese multinational corporation and conglomerate based in Japan with a very wide range of products and services , predominantly musical instruments , electronics , motorcycles and power sports equipment .

claim: Antarctica contains the North Pole.
LM: It contains the geographic South Pole and is situated in the Antarctic region of the Southern Hemisphere , almost entirely south of the Antarctic Circle , and is surrounded by the Southern Ocean . It is the southernmost point on the surface of the Earth and lies on the opposite side of the Earth from the North Pole .

claim: Gia is a turkey.
LM: Gia is a 1998 biographical HBO film about the life and times of one of America 's first supermodels , Gia Marie Carangi .

claim: The Dark Half is the first chapter of a novel called The Dark Half.
LM: The Dark Half is a 1993 American horror film adaptation of the Stephen King novel of the same name .

claim: The Dark Half is the first chapter of a novel called Twilight.
LM: The Dark Half is a 1993 American horror film adaptation of the Stephen King novel of the same name .

claim: Tom Felton is not an actor.
LM: Thomas Andrew " Tom " Felton ( born 22 September 1987 ) is an English actor .

claim: Doug Jones has never worked with Guillermo del Toro.
LM: He is perhaps best known for his collaborations with filmmaker Guillermo del Toro , starring in Mimic , as Abe Sapien in Hellboy and Hellboy II : The Golden Army , the Faun and the Pale Man in Pan 's Labyrinth , Crimson Peak and The Shape of Water .

claim: The President of Iraq is elected by the governor of Arkansas.
LM: The President is elected by the Council of Representatives by a two-thirds majority , and is limited to two four-year terms .

claim: The President of Iraq is elected by the governor of Iraq.
LM: The President is elected by the Council of Representatives by a two-thirds majority , and is limited to two four-year terms .

claim: Mike Pence is not a Republican.
LM: He served as the chairman of the House Republican Conference from 2009 to 2011 .

claim: The 12-hour clock divides the day into three periods.
LM: The 12-hour clock is a time convention in which the 24 hours of the day are divided into two periods : a.m. ( from the Latin , ante meridiem , meaning before midday ) and p.m. ( post meridiem , meaning past midday ) .

claim: The 12 - hour clock divides the day into two periods.
LM: The 12-hour clock is a time convention in which the 24 hours of the day are divided into two periods : a.m. ( from the Latin , ante meridiem , meaning before midday ) and p.m. ( post meridiem , meaning past midday ) .

claim: The Handmaid's Tale criticized the first Arthur C. Clarke Award.
LM: The Handmaid 's Tale won the 1985 Governor General 's Award and the first Arthur C. Clarke Award in 1987 ; it was also nominated for the 1986 Nebula Award , the 1986 Booker Prize , and the 1987 Prometheus Award .

claim: Dame Enid Diana Elizabeth Rig is the full name of Diana Rigg.

claim: The Murder of Roger Ackroyd is a science fiction.
LM: Sharif , who spoke Arabic , English , Greek , French , Spanish , Portuguese and Italian fluently , was often cast as a foreigner of some sort .

claim: Jazz Jennings hosts a YouTube series about her car repair business.
LM: In 1996 , he became the Mariners ' starting shortstop and finished second in voting for the AL MVP Award .

claim: Tom Hardy was in Paris.
LM: She was born and raised in Phoenix , Arizona , as the daughter of wealthy beer distributor Jim Hensley .

claim: Asia extends to the equator.
LM: Born in Leningrad ( now Saint Petersburg ) , Putin studied German in high school and speaks the language fluently . Saint Petersburg  is Russia 's second-largest city after Moscow , with five million inhabitants in 2012 , and an important Russian port on the Baltic Sea .

claim: Billy Clanton's full name is William Harrison Clanton which was given to him at birth.
LM: The console optionally included a redesigned Kinect sensor , marketed as the " Kinect 2.0 " , providing improved motion tracking and voice recognition for use in its graphical user interface ( GUI ) and games . Kinect ( codenamed Project Natal during development ) is a line of motion sensing input devices by Microsoft for Xbox 360 and Xbox One video game consoles and Microsoft Windows PCs .

claim: 2001: A Space Odyssey was produced using at least one American media company.
LM: The song was performed during the Super Bowl XXXVIII halftime show in 2004 .

claim: Winona Ryder received BAFTA Award nominations.
LM: Four passenger airliners operated by two major U.S. passenger air carriers ( United Airlines and American Airlines ) - all of which departed from airports in the northeastern United States bound for California - were hijacked by 19 al-Qaeda terrorists .

claim: Sonny with a Chance debuted in eastern the United States.
LM: Founded in 1899 by a group of Swiss , English and Catalan footballers led by Joan Gamper , the club has become a symbol of Catalan culture and Catalanism , hence the motto " Més que un club " ( " More than a club " ) .

claim: The Golden Gate Bridge only ever existed in Fresno, CA.
LM: William Henry Pratt ( 23 November 1887 - 2 February 1969 ) , better known by his stage name Boris Karloff , was an English actor who was primarily known for his typecast roles in horror films that depicted the characters Frankenstein and The Mummy .
